### move() {#a2dc5bdd64e84f396f958cd168e6e89e2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error IRMover::move (std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &gt; Src, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">GlobalValue</a> &#42; &gt; ValuesToLink, <a href="#ae604330ce66b619890d5a2ab883b0311">LazyCallback</a> AddLazyFor, bool IsPerformingImport)</>}>
Move in the provide values in <code>ValuesToLink</code> from <code>Src</code>.

<ul>
<li><code>AddLazyFor</code> is a call back that the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irmover">IRMover</a> will call when a global value is referenced by one of the ValuesToLink (transitively) but was not present in ValuesToLink. The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">GlobalValue</a> and a <a href="#a8533211312d3dd54fbe98b80c635e7d4">ValueAdder</a> callback are passed as an argument, and the callback is expected to be called if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">GlobalValue</a> needs to be added to the <code>ValuesToLink</code> and linked. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass">Pass</a> nullptr if there&#39;s no work to be done in such cases.</li>
<li><code>IsPerformingImport</code> is true when this IR link is to perform ThinLTO function importing from Src.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/linker/irmover-h/#l00079">79</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/linker/irmover-h">IRMover.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/linker/irmover-cpp/#l01763">1763</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/linker/irmover-cpp">IRMover.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
